alert.note: Alert for Appanoose; Davis; Monroe; Wayne (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 2:25PM CDT until March 31 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: The National Weather Service in Des Moines has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Monroe County in south central Iowa... West central Davis County in southeastern Iowa... Southeastern Wayne County in south central Iowa... Appanoose County in south central Iowa... * Until 315 PM CDT. * At 225 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Powersville, or 12 miles south of Corydon, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Seymour and Promise City around 235 PM CDT. Numa and Plano around 240 PM CDT. Cincinnati and Centerville Municipal Airport around 245 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Centerville, Mystic, Rathbun, Honey Creek State Park, Sharon Bluffs State Park, Lake Sundown, Moravia, Unionville and Udell. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for south central and southeastern Iowa.
